author: Special Correspondent
text:
A block president of the ruling Trinamool Congress who was arrested for allegedly trying to board a flight with a firearm and live cartridges was on Monday remanded in police custody for a day by a local court.

Naren Chakraborty, a leader from Pandeshwar in the State’s Bardhaman district, was arrested late on Sunday evening when a luggage scanner at Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport detected a firearm in his luggage and he could not show any licence for it.

The incident sparked a war of words between the Trinamool and the CPI(M).

While district TMC leaders said that Mr. Chakraborty has been framed, Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly Surjya Kanta Mishra accused the ruling party of being associated with “criminals and anti-socials.”

“The arrest of the TMC leader at Kolkata Airport with illegal firearms once again proves that the TMC is increasingly becoming a hub of criminals & anti-socials” Dr. Mishra said.
title: Trinamool leader sent to custody for carrying unlicensed gun
